website_summaries.verdict: The 19th iteration of Brooks' popular cushioned stability shoe.
pros: The shoe is available in a wide variety of colors and provides high cushioning without sacrificing stability
The GTS 19 is lightweight considering its plush cushioning and stable design
The sole is made of tough rubber, and there's plenty of arch support for those who need it
cons: New GuideRails system is not as supportive as tech in previous versions of the shoe, according to consumers

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a nurse, and I work 12 hour shifts. I love these shoes. This is a replacement for my last pair, which I’m only replacing due to my big toe now hanging out. At the end of a shift these help my back and knees not ache.
customer_reviews.author: phoenixashes

customer_reviews.title: Don’t wear well
customer_reviews.text: Shoes fit well and are comfortable. However, after a week of wearing, they already have a hole on the top part of the shoe. For the price, this shouldn’t happen. See picture attached.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Harbeck

customer_reviews.title: Like the old Adrenalines!
customer_reviews.text: After hating the Adrenaline 18, I must say the new 19s are amazing, much like the 17's and before. Everyone hated the 18s, Brooks must have listened and reverted back to the old feel. Great Shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT RUN SMALL IF YOU GET WIDE FIT
customer_reviews.text: Read all the reviews on here saying that they run small and so I ordered a half size up from what I usually get. Too fricken big. Have to return and get smaller size.. ugh
customer_reviews.author: Lisa D

customer_reviews.title: Much better design than the GTS 18...
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing this brand for the past eight years. The GTS 18 were wider and the support did not seem to hold up as well as my past shoes. The new GTS 19 is more narrow and seems to have much more support. They are a little stiff when you first wear them but I feel like I have a much more reliable shoe. I just ran a half marathon in my old GTS 18's but I am looking forward to many more miles in my new shoes. Thanks for getting it right this time Brooks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: So I just received my shoes yesterday and worked out legs today! These were amazing on my knee. I have this issue with my knee when I squat depending on the weight but I was able to hit an old PR without my brace and it felt amazing. I will update and see how they hold up over the next couple of months. I'm use to wearing Nike Free RN and the Nike Free RN 5.0 in a U.S. women's 8.5, which has a more snug fit. These shoes feel like I could easily fit a 8, no problem. I've found my new shoes!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Peebles

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these shoes. This is my second pair as in I have two! My other pair is the grey with lavender or purple. Anyway I was very hesitant able paying the price but they are THE most comfortable athletic shoe I have ever worn. I’m 51, getting back into jogging after being down with a back injury. I have had knee surgery before as well. So comfort & impact is most important. The cushion is great. It’s like running on foam, they are so cushy. Stable under me. I have no complaints. I have one for workout & one for everyday. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Fairy tale gal

customer_reviews.title: Good for correcting pronation - and the color isn’t blue, it’s aqua
customer_reviews.text: I pronate, and this shoe was recommended by a Physical Therapist as helping with that problem. So far, so good. I wear orthotics, so the arch support I have is from those. I like the toe box - roomy enough that my toes don’t feel cramped, but not too loose. My orthotics fit fine, with the removal of the liner that comes in the shoes. My only surprise is that they aren’t blue, as they look in the photo - they’re aqua. It’s OK, but not what I was wanting, as I wear a lot of true blues. These have a lot of green in the color.
customer_reviews.author: N. Pugh

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe !
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. Lots of support. I normally Wear a 9, but have always worn a 9.5 in Brooks Adrenaline. I also Got a 9.5 in these. Love them ! Only Shoes that don’t hurt my feet !
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Shindle

customer_reviews.title: They're Brooks, so ofcourse they're great.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful support for overpronation. Order a half size up so your toes aren't scrunched up.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: The fabric has holes within 2 months
customer_reviews.text: The fit and feel is great but the fabric is already wearing away. There are holes in the fabric around the ankles, after less than 2 months. I paid too much money expecting quality and I’m disappointed. I’ll buy a different brand next time.
customer_reviews.author: Cristy

customer_reviews.title: These are the most comfortable shoes I own
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have almost cured my plantar fasciitis in less than a week of wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Christy C. Franks

customer_reviews.title: Shoe runs very large
customer_reviews.text: I love my current Brooks Anthem shoes and finding out that they are no longer being made I decided to try Brooks Adrenaline. As soon as I received the Adrenaline's I thought they had to have sent me a much larger pair of shoes. I normally wear 6.5 to 7 in sneakers, and the Anthems fit great in the 6.5 so I was very surprised that these shoes were much bigger. Not only are they longer, but they also have a much wider toe box. I am going to try a size down (6) to see if they fit better. On the upside, the shoes seemed to be nicely cushioned.
customer_reviews.author: A. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Brooks adrenaline gts 19 fit perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. I have back problems and a recent bunion removal. These shoes fit well and do not tire out my feet. I do not like shoes that are overly "spongy" with an overabundance of padding. These shoes absorb the hit of pavement but are a firm hold on my feet adding support where needed. I'm buying 3 more!
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes!!!
customer_reviews.text: It never fails - I get a new pair of sneakers and think that they fit well and wear them enough that they can't be returned. Later I find out that they are not as comfortable as I initially thought. I don't think that is going to be a problem with these Brooks. Love them! They were comfortable right out of the box. Usually I have to put shoe inserts in my sneakers, but not with these. They are so comfortable with the inserts they came with - like walking on clouds. Will definitely get another pair in a different color. I upsized 1/2 a size up and glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Unsure of what to do with this VERY expensive shoes
customer_reviews.text: While the style and fit of this shoe is good. The problem is that there is a very hard knob on the back of the shoe. It rubbed a dime size amount of skin from my lower leg. I was bleeding and it hurt so bad I had to stop my workout. Even with 3 bandaids on the back on my leg that hard knob rubs against my skin. I'm not sure what to do. My old pair of Brooks does not have this issue. I have a 5K scheduled in six weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: “ILove My New Shoes”
customer_reviews.text: My shoes a a bit too large but I need the extra room to stretch my toes. I missed the support of new shoes these are just what I needed. My shoes help me stay on my feet at work. I get around with my students much faster. I can keep up with my four and five year olds with energy and enthusiasm! As Pete The Cat says, “I love my new shoes!”
customer_reviews.author: Tawanna F. Graham-Badgett

customer_reviews.title: Great Sneakers!
customer_reviews.text: I have been reading about these sneakers and held off because of the price thinking they would fit like all of my others. I ordered a pair for myself and have to say that these fit so much better than any others that I have. They didn't need breaking in (for me). I put them on and did a nice HIIT class. They were so comfortable throughout that I didn't feel like I had sneakers on. Would definitely recommend and will be switching to this brand from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Pat G

customer_reviews.title: comfort
customer_reviews.text: I give these shoes 100 stars - truly the most comfortable shoe I have ever worn, even with my plantar fasciitis problem. They are awesome, worth every penny. So happy I found them here with my size.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Lubinski

customer_reviews.title: Comfort, style, and support!
customer_reviews.text: Ive been searching for a supportive shoe for my planters fasciitis that had style as well as comfort, I found it with this shoe. I wanted to wait until I worked out in them before I gave my review, I love the the lightweight feeling but it still has good support. A very comfortable shoe!
customer_reviews.author: D. Rohen

customer_reviews.title: Great for bunions
customer_reviews.text: Roomy toe box, I have large bunions and these shoes did not cause any bunion pain! I bought the wide width and they are great. I did not come into the house and immediately take off my shoes after my run! Light and bouncy on the road.
customer_reviews.author: jessica H.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED: bought these in Nov. 2019 and they have already broke down. I have been a loyal Brooks fan for several years, but the last two pairs haven’t lasted more then a year. I thought when the ones before these broke down it was just a defected pair, but these new ones have done the exact same thing. They don’t have many miles on them as I live in MN and do do any outdoor running and not a lot on the treadmills either. Pretty disappointed in the quality for the price of the shoe. Love them! Brooks are my go to for running. Have been buying them for years.
customer_reviews.author: M.T.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: I have always heard great things about Brooks shoes. I went to their website and did their shoe finder option. I had found that the Adrenaline line was best for plantar fasciitis. I didn't think that I would be that Cinderella who would have her life changed by a pair of shoes. I was skeptical so I kept my Ascis on ready standby (this brand is the one I have been wearing since being diagnosed). Putting on the shoes have helped my problem. I am not in as much pain. I do use the orthodics my doctor gave me but with the combination, it has decreased my pain.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Buy a half size up!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my regular size initially and the shoe was too small. I returned and got a half size up and they fit perfectly! It didn’t take too long to break them in, I got a blister on the back of my foot and that was it. I’m a server and spend all day on my feet, and I’m also in nursing school so I got these to wear in my future career as a nurse on my feet all day. These shoes are perfect, I love them! Comfortable and supportive
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: THESE ARE GREAT SUPPORT SHOES
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a runner, but these shoes are terrific for stabilizing feet that pronate or go the opposite way. I have a wide toe box, and these fit perfectly. I also have one "new" knee and a bad one, and these are reliable for a safe, comfortable walking show. I already had the same pair in another color, so it was easy to order it on Amazon in a new color and be sure they would fit well. I love these shoes - and I walked out of the store in the first pair, which is a 1/100 experience for me. Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Ozmatoo

customer_reviews.title: These are durable and stable.
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that I wouldn’t be able to find my shoes after wearing the sole through. I’m a bit spastic and if anything, I supinate, but have been loving my old Adrenalines every day for 8 years. I finally had to take the plunge. Yup, these are my shoes! So stable! I use them for everyday use and have trouble with balance and hand coordination, so I use them with Loc Laces, and life is perfect! Brooks for life!
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: The specs for this shoe say that it's good for people who have arches that are either flat or medium. I need a significant amount of support in my shoes, because I have flat feet. But without my inserts, these shoes felt hard and uncomfortable. With my inserts, the shoes were slippy in the heel. When shoes are supposed to be meant for flat feet and are expensive, then I expect better than that. I returned the shoes. They may be okay for people with medium arches, but after my experience, I suggest staying away from them if you have very flat feet.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Room for bunions and hammer toes
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of Brooks. Love the color. I like that the insole is removable so I can insert my custom orthodic. The upper material is forgiving to my hammer toes and bunions. Unfortunately, the soles are a little wider than the upper part of the shoes and I occasionally hit the opposite shoe while power walking on the treadmill. That wouldn't be terrible except that the sole material is wearing away and leaving white crumbs on the track which then is slung off onto the floor. Haven't worn them 2 months yet. Probably won't buy another pair like these.
customer_reviews.author: M. Prosperie

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort and support
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to wear to work in the medical field. I am on my feet on concrete floors all day and these give me to much needed support and comfort I need. Light weight. Snazzy design gets lots of compliments as well. I am ordering another pair in a different pattern now that I know how well they fit.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe for Underpronation
customer_reviews.text: First, I love Brooks Running Shoes. They are the only shoe that I don't have to break in. They feel good from the start and no blisters on heels. I was wearing Ghost, but found that these had a little more support for underpronation. Along with the inserts, these shoes do a much better job of keeping my right foot from rolling off to the outer edge. So far the soles are wearing evenly and not just on the outer edge. Will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Clow

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but hard to break in
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are as wonderfully comfortable as every other pair of Brooks shoes I have owned. I ordered 1/2 size up, as several reviews suggested, and they fit beautifully. My one caveat is they are hard to break in on the back of the ankles. I've worn them several days now, but they are still rubbing painfully on the back of my heels. Even with band-aids and heavy socks, they are digging a bit painfully. I'm hoping that with a bit more wear they will settle in to being as comfortable as my previous pairs of Brooks.
customer_reviews.author: hambrick91

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, recommended by podiatrist
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes. Super comfortable. Recommended by my podiatrist for metatarsalgia (pain in ball of foot at base of toes). I wear them every day for both around the house, going to work (have a solid black pair for that), and for long brisk walks. Really great. The only thing is... the cushy feeling only lasted about 3 months of constant wear. I had hoped for longer.
customer_reviews.author: nalissa

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are great!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have great support and allow proper airflow. I was having heel pain and wasn't running well as a result. I got fitted at a reputable athletic shoe store and bought these shoes. I went back a few months later and they no longer had these so I found them on Amazon and bought them. I am so pleased with the fit and comfort. I had over 400 miles on the last pair and plan to do that with these.
customer_reviews.author: Biker X-Ray tech

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are keepers!
customer_reviews.text: I was having a lot more hip and knee pain. My other Brooks were over two yrs old and very worn. It feels good to get back in a new pair. The toe was a little more snug than I expected but should be fine. The front part of the shoe/sole dips quicker than I am used to and I was concerned about it hurting the ball of my foot. The ball on my right foot started to get a little numb but it didn't last. Thankfully I am already having less pain. Thank you for such great products!
customer_reviews.author: ALS

customer_reviews.title: Hallelujah! My feet are happy!
customer_reviews.text: I've heard great things about Brooks shoes, now I can see why. First day after I received these shoes, I took a 3 mile walk (no breaking in period) my feet never ached, or hurt the entire walk. Usually after I take off my shoes, the pain will start in the ball of my feet and my knees. Not after wearing these shoes! I was amazed at the comfort I immediately felt with these shoes. I will def be buying more Brooks shoes in the future.
customer_reviews.author: ceceb

customer_reviews.title: No break in needed.
customer_reviews.text: I love the feel of these shoes! They give my flat feet great support, and I didn’t have to break them in. This is my second pair of Adrenaline 19s.
customer_reviews.author: T. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great work shoes
customer_reviews.text: I work as a RN in acute hospital care with 12 hour shifts on my feet. I can’t wear clogs because I’m chronically clumsy and twisted my ankle. These are 10x more comfortable for my feet and lower back.
customer_reviews.author: Hales

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but too large.
customer_reviews.text: These were beautiful shoes, however the size was about a size too big, I’m not sure if that was an error on my part or if I have been buying the wrong size. Either way, they were drastically big, I returned to the seller and the seller refunded my money, (subtracting the return shipping). Overall, super nice shoes though and the design is enviable to want I have now.
customer_reviews.author: Caterina

customer_reviews.title: Support-excellent fit-a bit narrow by pinky. Give it some time!
customer_reviews.text: The first time I ran with these I was not happy. They felt stiff, heavy I was thinking of returning them. The second time I ran 5 miles with them And was much much better. My left pinky toe was hurting a lot it feels like it’s squashed and bit tight and narrow. It needs to break in more use much better. It’s a keeper but work them out! True to size but I always buy 1/2 size bigger in sneakers! Hope to get a lot of use with these over the summer!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for wide toes and high arches
customer_reviews.text: I've had Brook's in the past so ordering them online was almost perfect. I knew what size and width work for me, but some styles can still hurt my toes and the bottoms of the balls of my feet. This style is PERFECT for my high arches, supination (foot rolls outward), and wide toe area. They seem to be made of quality materials that will last my rough handling for a year when I usually wear down the outer edges of the soles and get tears on the fabric around the top front.
customer_reviews.author: Smiley

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes for plantar fasciitis or heel pain
customer_reviews.text: These shoes CURED my plantar fasciitis. The heel pain I was having was so bad that my feet hurt from the second I stepped out of bed. First I bought some Vionics sandals, and they were better for my feet than regular flip-flops, but my feet were still killing me. So I did some more research, and Brooks was recommended everywhere for plantar fasciitis. After the first weekend of working 12 hour shifts on my feet (I work in healthcare) in these shoes, my feet felt BETTER than when I had been home doing nothing. I can’t say enough about these shoes. Worth EVERY PENNY. Now that I know they work, I would pay even more for them.
customer_reviews.author: 2 Girls' Mom

customer_reviews.title: I'm a Brooks girl for LIFE now.
customer_reviews.text: I've been running for over a decade, and somehow didn't know how amazing this brand was. A co-worker clued me in, and I but the bullet on a pair. They are the MOST COMFORTABLE, springy, supportive running shoes I have ever worn. My previous go-to was Saucony, but they seemed to wear out quicker and quicker. I'm hoping these last a long time because I feel like they actually inspire me to run faster and longer!
customer_reviews.author: Mish

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe except for the uncomfortable heel!
customer_reviews.text: I run daily and therefore have gone through multiple pairs of the Adrenaline GTS 18 and assumed that the new GTS 19 would fit similarly. Unfortunately, I was wrong. The heel “collar” is very stiff and inflexible. Even just with minimal wear around the house, they gave me a blister and had to be returned.:(
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Davis

customer_reviews.title: Extreme comfort
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are a godsend after just being diagnosed with plantar fasciitis and bunions. I feel like I’m walking on air or driving a car with brand new shocks. The wide width is fantastic for bunions, alleviating the pressure and making a huge difference in just two weeks time. They are a little bigger than pictured but worth it because the larger sole provides excellent cushion. Would totally buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jensciorty

customer_reviews.title: Defective shoe????
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying Brooks for years because I overpronate but with these shoes there wasn't enough support and my right foot turned in. Over the years I have found some Brooks that I really like, I wish they would still offer some of the older shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen

customer_reviews.title: SIMPLY THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: Brooks Adrenaline is my absolute favorite shoe!! When I was diagnosed with Plantar Fasciitis several years ago and went through a year of treatment, I was fitted with this brand and have never looked back. I have never had anymore problems with my heels. I recommend this shoe without reservations!!!
customer_reviews.author: callaway10.0

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Quick shipping and perfect fit. I have an older pair of Adrenalines, and these are even better. Hugs for my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Blisters!
customer_reviews.text: I have worn the GTS Adrenaline shoes for years and this is the first time I have ever had horrible blisters on my heels from them or any other shoe really. I bought my usual size 8 and they seem to fit differently--a little bit longer and narrower. The heel piece is higher than my GTS 18. I hope I can get them to work out eventually. They are not cheap and so I'm super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, cloud like fit
customer_reviews.text: True to its name, Brooks Adrenaline 19 DELIVERS. This shoe is like a soft pillow on troubled feet. This price was a bit lower and needed to start wearing 1/2 size up. I don't wear socks. This shoe is for light walking, a few trips around the mall or whatever. You can wear the shoe loose, if your feet begin the swell, or tighten up for more support. This shoe is for PF sufferers as well.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Yu

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect workout shoe! Even for bunion and so lightweight I can travel with them!
customer_reviews.author: Laura S

customer_reviews.title: In love
customer_reviews.text: I love these!! I’m so happy I splurged and spent a little more than I normally would. These shoes are very well made and I love the style! I might never get another pair of New Balance or Nike’s again. My foot is a little wide and I got the wide width. Very happy I did.
customer_reviews.author: L. Devine

customer_reviews.title: Did not seem like a quality shoe
customer_reviews.text: Run very small. Right shoe seemed smaller than left. My left foot is the longest of the two. Should have returned but had already wore them. Even though they are a Wide the shoes sure are narrow. Not enough toe room. Do not recommend shoe
customer_reviews.author: Dianne D Dabney

customer_reviews.title: Great "indoor" shoe for treadmill and workouts, fit as expected from previous Brooks shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable and flexible, allowing me to do HIIT intervals on the treadmill. I use these shoes only indoors, and keep another, sturdier pair, for outdoors walking to preserve treadwear and to keep the treadmill area cleaner. I have been a long-time customer of Brooks Addiction walking shoes, and based my order size of 8-medium on those other shoes. Note that for normal dress shoes I wear a 6.5 B. I wear Thorlo 84N running socks with these shoes, and it is important to measure feet and fit shoe with that thick sock on.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy L.Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: High arc feet and strained tendons
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, so comfortable. Really gave me the support I needed. I have a high arc in my foot and the shoe fit to allow my feet mold perfectly in to the show. Worth buying especially if you have knee problems or strained tendons in your foot. Also let’s you walk comfortably and let’s your feet breathe.
customer_reviews.author: John Glyder

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Brooks Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this shoe for 5 weeks and it is already ripping in the same location as my last pair of Brooks GTS shoes! Seems pretty strange that the shoe wears in the same location... left shoe, inner area, close to last shoe string hole! Poor quality if both my Brooks shoes have wear in the same location. This shoe showing wear in only 5 weeks now!!! I’ve been wearing Brooks shoes for over 10 years and never had a problem, but my last 2 pairs have been no good:(
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Pennock

customer_reviews.title: Defective...ankle pain
customer_reviews.text: Something was pocking out into my ankle on one of the shoes. It was uncomfortable and painful. I retuned them and ordered last years model of the Brooks, i know I like them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable heel however the toe box is very tight with my orthotic in it.
customer_reviews.text: Also after several weeks, the inside of the shoe at the very back top is grating on my skin. It is like there is a sharp ledge there under the padding! I wish they sold a wide width because of the tightness of the toe box with my Dr orthotic. VERY TIGHT toebox. I need the next largest size. But the heel has a softness to the bottom. Several wks later: I ended up going straight to the Brooks website for my new pair of shoes and they have the wide option. The wide in a 1/2 size bigger is a perfect fit with lots of room in the toebox.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanka

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes...only brand/style for both my husband and me.
customer_reviews.author: JH-OC

customer_reviews.title: Finally
customer_reviews.text: My wife is the pickiest person in the world when it comes to choosing athletic shoes. I have spent well over 6 month bringing home shoes and returning them due to her schedule. This is the only pair that she loves due to the arch support and shock absorption while jogging. They are not the most expensive pair I brought home either, which is a plus for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo J Perez

customer_reviews.title: A Must Buy!
customer_reviews.text: The Adrenaline line is Amazing! They are the best shoes I have ever owned! I have a neuropathy problem that causes pain all the time and swelling. With these shoes I can actually have more balance and it makes every step seem easier for someone like me to take. The Adrenaline 19s are even better than the past adrenaline shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY!  NEEDED A GOOD NEW SHOE FOR TRIP TO SEDONA AND GRAND CANYON & HOME
customer_reviews.text: PLANTAR FASCIITIS OK EVERYONE HAS IT RIGHT? LOL WELL, IT HELPS, IT DOES. GREAT SHOES...I TRIED I CAN'T TELL YOU HOW MANY RUNNING SHOES AND NOW I OWN 3 COLORS OF THESE. I HOPE THEY DON'T CHANGE THE STRUCTURE AS THEY OFTEN DO IN NEWER MODELS. BUT I AM SET FOR AWHILE WITH 3 PR. DONT HESITATE OR AT LEAST TRY. MIGHT NOT BE GOOD FOR EVERYONE, BUT GREAT FOR ME WITHOUT HAVING TO GET NEW ORTHOTICS BUT ORTHOTICS WILL WORK TOO.
customer_reviews.author: MMW

customer_reviews.title: Great support
customer_reviews.text: I over pronate when I walk and this causes a lot of soreness in my feet. I am a teacher, so I’m on my feet a lot. These shoes are extremely comfortable and provide a lot of support. I bought them in all black, so I can wear them to school without looking like I’m going running. These fit me just as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie G

customer_reviews.title: Very supportive!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Brooks for a few years now for running. after making the switch from Asics ( which would get a hole in the toe box after a few months. I bought these in black to wear to work. As a teacher, I am on my feet a lot and sometimes would forget to change my sneakers to my flats. I do think these are a bit smaller than the 18s and might have to go up a 1/2 size for running.
customer_reviews.author: momof2

customer_reviews.title: Feel wonderful, heel stabilizer is great!
customer_reviews.text: Just started wearing these. And they fit great. I wear a size 11..and I always need to be careful on having enough width and length.. I tend to be more than a B but less than a wide. The ankle stabilizer is great, toes feel good. And enough room for a heel insole. And I like that they come in a solid black..may have to purchase another pair!
customer_reviews.author: Scubaspice

customer_reviews.title: Good arch support and comfortable toe box!
customer_reviews.text: I swear by Brooks running shoes, so this, for me, is a no-brainer. I loved my Launch 5's, and then got a pair of Launch 6's a few months back... and those didn't work as well for me. So I ordered the Adrenaline GTS 19s. GREAT SHOE! I have wider feet, and my feet are flat, so having a good arch with a good-fitting toe box is necessary. The shoes I had before didn't seem to have as much of an arch as these do. I love these! They feel so comfortable. They are snug where they need to be, and roomy in the toe. I love it! And the arches... my feet don't hurt now.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bergstrom

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality- seems busted with moderate wear
customer_reviews.text: I wear these shoes about 3x a week and they fit perfectly. The right seem broke out and they have a 6 inch long hole. They are used in a retail enviroment and I have never had this happen with another pair of shoes ever. Very poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy 2217

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold up
customer_reviews.text: My wife has used the shoes for about 3 weeks just for running not for everyday. They have a hole to the foam on the top of the shoe by the top lace hole. I asked for an exchange which they did. Will update if this happened to just be a defect. She says she loves them but if they are not going to last she will go another direction. They never did pick up the return. I have been putting them out now for 4 days. Not sure if they want them back or if I should toss them. UPS was supposed to pick them up I thought.
customer_reviews.author: Wagon

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I got these shoes right before Thanksgiving, and the soles are coming off and the toe box is starting to get holes. They lasted 4 months, only worn indoors, for work. Total waste of money. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Different fabric, not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I hate the new fabric on these Adrenalines. I've always gotten this style and had zero break in time or discomfort. That is no longer! The shoe rubs against the medial side of my big toe so badly it just aches intolerably. I should have returned them but tried to give them some break in time to no avail. I dont know that I'll ever purchase these again, sadly.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica W

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable on the treadmill
customer_reviews.text: I am on a quest for walking shoes for my trouble feet. This go-around these are my third pair. So far, so good. I wear a 10 medium and these fit perfectly. I put my orthotic in with no problem. My test for shoes is to walk on the treadmill for as long as it takes. Usually it only takes 1/4 to 1/2 miles to ferret out problems. I walked a mile at a good clip for me and they still feel fine. There are a couple of twinges, but I will walk a few more times on the treadmill before making the final call. We will see if they hold up to daily wear.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Ramseyer

customer_reviews.title: love the fit and support
customer_reviews.text: this is the BEST pair of Brooks I've found in years!! the toe box is wider to allow toe movement, while the lace up area is secure and can easily be adjusted. I have a little bit of higher arch, so I just added a sole insert on top the better support my arch- still the best fitting shoe! I can truly feel what they call "guiderail" support. Will buy again, thank you
customer_reviews.author: Kathy H

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled with the shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Thrilled with the shoe! I have a whole assortment of athletic shoes, and use them regularly... Some are ready for the trash! I needed a new pair of solid walking/running shoes and have had a Brooks model before... Unfortunately They did not have this new style in a regular width, so I took a chance on the wide width... And they were absolutely perfect! More comfortable than my past regular pairs and yet do not look like clown shoes at all LOL...Very cushy... For under $100, I think this was a terrific buy!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy  Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Nice sneaker.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two more pairs because when these are gone never know what the next yr brings. Don’t like them as much as gts 12,15, & 18 but they’re good. They run a little too long. Until they’re broken in I put a little organic lambs wool in the toe box & it does the trick. I like a wider sneaker without ordering a wide & these accommodate my preference. I haven’t tried the gts 20 because I wasn’t happy with the color combinations. People stop me admiring these sneakers.
customer_reviews.author: Lives to read!

customer_reviews.title: Amazing comfort
customer_reviews.text: I love the way they fit and stabilize my feet. I work in a medical facility and walk a lot . I bought my first pair after the advice of my sister the night before we took our granddaughter to Disney. Had I not had these shoes I couldn’t have averaged the 6 miles a day. I have since purchased a second pair. Wish they offered a bigger variety of colors.
customer_reviews.author: Lois A. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 size up and perfect for me!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been wearing the men’s version of these for years. I finally broke down and bought a pair. I’m pretty much a solid 8 in every shoe I wear. I bought these in an 8. Just were too tight and didn’t fit right. I returned them to try the 8.5 and they are perfect. I wore them and walked 30000 steps today and they were awesome. No break in period. Perfect. 1/2 size up and completely satisfied. Love them! Can’t wait to run in them.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Most Comfortable Ever!
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought these because her feet are flat, and she needs good arch support. She has tried many name brands with some success, but these shoes beat them all in her estimation. I have heard nothing but good things about these shoes from her since she started wearing them. They needed no break-in period. She says tell everyone these shoes are more expensive then she wanted to pay, but they are worth every penny to have shoes that just "feel great".
customer_reviews.author: ldave

customer_reviews.title: Great for my posterior tibial tendon dysfunction/flat feet
customer_reviews.text: I've worn Brooks for at least 10 years and always buy whatever shoe helps with overpronation. Usually it's a tradeoff between my ankle hurting from the overpronation correction or my knees hurting from it. This shoe doesn't kill my feet or my knees and I've worn it so much I've actually torn a hole in the lining around the ankle. This isn't a knock on Brooks, it's a compliment that I've worn them enough to actually wear them OUT.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: I am on my 3rd pair
customer_reviews.text: I have worn New Balance for 20+ years. I recently went to my local running store and they suggested these Brooks. I immediately loved the feel. I am now on my third pair. I actually have a narrow foot and am wearing a medium width and am very happy with them. It seems like a shoe that would work well for many. I am a walker, not a runner and I get about 7 months out of each pair, but I do put on a lot miles and essentially live in them.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: I love mybrooks
customer_reviews.text: I love my Brooks. Always have. Run happy. Fit great. Love the support. I have plantar fasciitis & I love my brooks. This is my fourth or fifth pair. I will buy more Brooks Adreneline shoes when this pair wears out. Which btw, is usually after about 300 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Like the old brooks
customer_reviews.text: I wore Brooks GTS Adrenaline all the time about 15 years ago, and then something changed in the design that just didn’t work for me. I kept trying to return to the brand from time to time and this shoe was the Brooks winner that works for me. These shoes have the support I need and an ample toe box, which is an issue for me with other brands. I’m actually going to order a second pair for backup - that’s how great these shoes are for me.
customer_reviews.author: M. Finch

customer_reviews.title: gave me planar facistiis
customer_reviews.text: never had more shoe problems in my life they took weeks to break in and then when I thought they were fine, they gave me heel pain terrible heel pain. Plantar faciatiis and I have never had issues in my life. Only when I wear these shoes do I have issues so now I have to pay for inserts.
customer_reviews.author: brittany

customer_reviews.title: Order at least 1/2 size up
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th pair of Brooks Adrenaline GTS, I get a new pair ~every two years. This is by far the cushiest pair. I haven't worn them for running yet, but I have worn them out shopping and I really like the feel/fit. I have a wide foot and normally wear a 9.5 or 10 in most shoes. The 10.5 fits perfect. Update: After wearing for a couple months running, IMHO, these are the best Adrenaline GTS yet!
customer_reviews.author: Merrilyn Schlenker

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and good fit for my wide feet and orthotics for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I wear wide shoes and have problems finding ones that are wide enough, but not too wide. These were perfect. I also have orthotics for plantar fasciitis and even with those in the shoes they fit great.
customer_reviews.author: Kelcrafts44

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shows
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. Working two jobs that require me on my feet and needed something I could just jump in and get going from the start. They're a bit stiff like any new shoe, but they're still very comfortable even on the first day. So glad I found these. The arch support is very minimal, but I made sure to get a large enough shoe to fit some inserts in so it's not a problem for me. Definitely going to buy these again!
customer_reviews.author: Ashleigh

customer_reviews.title: Good Support
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis in my feet and my podiatrist recommended Brooks shoes for support to lessen the pain when walking. Right out of the box these Adrenaline sneakers were comfortable and supportive. Not one blister! These shoes have been a blessing to my feet. For me, the Brooks Adrenaline are the most comfortable. Tried the Brooks Launch and they were not quite as comfy. A little pricey, but in this case you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: luv2shoponline

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought both the Adrenaline 19 and the Ghost 11 to try out. I'll be keeping both for different workouts. The Adrenaline provides the extra stability I need for sprints and longer runs as I do overpronate some. Got fitted in store first, so knew I needed a half size larger than normal and the wide width doesn't make my toes feel squished. Very comfortable shoes and the quality seems excellent as well. Love that they're available in more neutral colors on Amazon
customer_reviews.author: outdoors girl

customer_reviews.title: brooks
customer_reviews.text: If you want comfort all day these are what you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Ann M Peters

customer_reviews.title: Consistent
customer_reviews.text: I switched over to Brooks Adrenaline a year ago after I was fed up with the inconsistency in sizing of my previous ‘go to’ running shoes (ASIC GT 2000). The support is good for any overpronatot like me. I do find that with any running shoes I have to switch out for Greensoles inserts, but I think that is a product of my special feet that need even more support :). This is my second pair of Brooks Adrenaline and I’ve been happily putting in 10-25 miles running weekly. They are quality, don’t rub or give blisters. I like the slight elasticity in the shoe laces. Would recommend to a friend...but my best friend already swears by these as well!
customer_reviews.author: Nell

customer_reviews.title: A++++ Comfort
customer_reviews.text: I'm a cashier standing in one spot for an entire shift. I have never felt so much comfort before. I have wide feet and the 2E fits so nice in the toe box. I also have flat feet and the arch is perfect...no uncomfortable lump. 8.5 is true to size. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: mrsplum1

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes! This is my second pair
customer_reviews.text: I've worn this style of shoe for over 1 year. My first pair was from a running store, which I was fitted for after my walk was evaluated on a treadmill w a camera. Both feet pronate, which was causing knee pain. An old hamstring injury on my right side was also becoming aggravated. Knee pain is gone and. These have a good amount of cushion. I use them for walking/gym workouts. Unfortunately, my running days are over.
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: Bye Bye Brooks!
customer_reviews.text: I really wish Brooks would stop recreating the wheel. This is why people look to the competition when they no longer carry a certain style. People need consistency when it comes to shoes and the lack of consistency With brooks from one version to the next makes it easy to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Beware of sizing issues! These sneakers have very strange sizing.
customer_reviews.text: Even though these are last season's sneakers, I loved the GTS-19 and not so much the GTS-20. Sadly, I can not wear these at all and I did not try them on until my last pair needed replacing. I expected the same size and instead these are VERY narrow and not the medium width I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Dunreith Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love Brooks. Best feel and looks. I would buy them again. The only think I could say is that the sole and shoe is black, which is what I wanted, but since the sole sticks out a little, it makes my foot look a little wide. The navy blue with the white sole does not do that, but no big problem, I would buy the blacks again. Tlhey are so comfortable and cool with the mesh tops.
customer_reviews.author: Ruthie

customer_reviews.title: Okay but not for me
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are super cute, and I really wanted to love them, I heard great things about them and did a TON of research. I'm a novice runner and am switching from Nike Free RN 2018, I run on roads as well as dirt roads. My feet did NOT like these shoes, I wore them for a couple days and then ran in them, my feet were so sore, the balls of my feet were killing me, as well as my legs. I had never had that problem from other shoes. They felt heavy and like my legs didn't want to move in them. Too bad, sending them back.
customer_reviews.author: Joan C Swan

customer_reviews.title: A very cozy shoe
customer_reviews.text: I typically wear a 9 but found that the 9.5 was a good fit for me, and with bunions the wide was a must. They are very comfortable and on my first 4 mile walk my feet didn't hurt. My toes slide around a little in the toe box which could partially be to the insole material and the wide size...maybe I need to lace tighter by my toes too. Overall a wonderful shoe; I bought 2 pair!
customer_reviews.author: kdmark

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable Shoes Ever
customer_reviews.text: I love how this shoe fits across your toes and the support is the best ever. At 75 years old, I can honestly say this is the best fitting tennis shoe I’ve ever had on my feet. My daughter is 35, stands on her feet as a cook and I bought her this same shoe, she loved the color of mine, and she agrees it’s the best shoe for work or play. That old saying “you get what you pay for “ well these are pricey but so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha

customer_reviews.title: Just right!
customer_reviews.text: I have a high arch and I need shoes that can support that. This shoes have the perfect cushioning., there nothing to dislike about them.
customer_reviews.author: Zaferlerim

customer_reviews.title: Soooo Comfortable!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I have had multiple pairs of Brook's Adrenaline sneakers. I stopped wearing them because the sizing changed (still the same size in all my other shoes). I was having trouble finding another pair of sneakers recently and decided to try them again. I bought a half size bigger this time and I love them again! I have been on my feet for over 12 hours each day for over a week and my feet haven't hurt at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kris W.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, light weight, supportive
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is living up to the positive reviews I read before purchasing. If I had to do it all over again, I'd order a darker color because I can see these gorgeous white shoes are going to be a challenge to keep clean. Otherwise, all good things to say about the fit, support, and, especially the cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: FlickRN3

customer_reviews.title: Really good shoe for Training
customer_reviews.text: I was so very excited to try out these shoes after reading the review. Although I didn't find them particularly cushy, I really love running in them! I don't have to think about my feet/shoes. I can feel the guide rails correcting my stride which is excellent and which cause slight discomfort in the beginning but now, I'm becoming accustomed to the fit of the shoe. Very spacious toe box which is essential for any long distance runner and I actually like the colours though some would disagree. Haven't put in that many miles in them just yet but I'm definitely looking forward to!
customer_reviews.author: Reanna E.

product_meta.title: Brooks Adrenaline GTS 19
feature_bullets: SHOE SIZE: "B" = Medium width, "D" = Wide width, "2A" = Narrow width, "2E" = Extra wide width

FOOT SUPPORT: Ideal for runners with all arches looking for support. Our new Guiderail Support System focuses beyond the feet to the most injury-prone part of a runner’s body: the knees. GuideRails keep you moving comfortably by keeping excess movement in check.
CUSHIONED FEEL: Soft and protective, these shoes provide just the right amount of cushion in each step to let you float through your run, walk and everyday life.
BALANCED, SOFT CUSHIONING: BioMoGo DNA and DNA LOFT cushioning work together to provide a just-right softness underfoot without losing responsiveness and durability—yet it feels lighter than ever.
MODERNIZED FIT: Engineered mesh and the 3D Fit Print upper provide the structure and proven fit of this Go-To Shoe with a streamlined look.
